Class Country

  • java.lang.Object
    • Country

  • public class Country
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a whole country including all the cities and roads in it. The cities and roads are represented by a HashMap.
    Version:
    25/11-2018 19:00, version 1.2
    Author:
    Steffen W. Christensen

    • Constructor Detail

      • Country

        public Country(java.lang.String name,
               java.util.Map<City,java.util.List<Road>> network)
        Constructor for the Country object.
        Parameters:
        name - The country's name.
        network - The network of Cities and Roads in this Country.

    • Method Detail

      • addRoads

        public void addRoads(City a,
                     City b,
                     int length)
        Adds a road, or multiple roads, from City a to City b of length. If a and b are in same country, create a Road object from and to a and b. If only a or b is in the country, create a one-direction Road object starting from which one is in the country.
        Parameters:
        a - The first City object.
        b - The second City object.
        length - Length between the two cities.

      • bonus

        public int bonus(int value)
        Returns the bonus value a player should receive when arriving to the city, as long as the given value is above 0.
        Parameters:
        value - The upper limit of the random number.
        Returns:
        A random number between [0,value], or 0.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Country other)
        Checks if this country's name is equal to the given country's name. If the same object is given, automatically return true.
        Parameters:
        other - Country to compare with.
        Returns:
        Boolean that determines if it is the same country or not.

      • getCities

        public java.util.List<City> getCities()
        Returns a sorted list of all cities in the Country. If no cities are to be found, an empty list is returned instead.
        Returns:
        All cities in the country, or empty list.

      • getCity

        public City getCity(java.lang.String name)
        Finds a city among the list of cities by looking for its name. If no such city can be found, null is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the city to be found.
        Returns:
        The city that was found, or null.

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Returns the current game object,
        Returns:
        The current Game object.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the current Country's name, for example, "Country 1".
        Returns:
        The Country's name.

      • getNetwork

        public java.util.Map<City,java.util.List<Road>> getNetwork()
        Returns the current Country's network, this includes all Cities and Roads in the Country.
        Returns:
        The Country's network.

      • getRoads

        public java.util.List<Road> getRoads(City c)
        Returns the current Country's roads based on the parameter, this means if the City can be found, all Roads starting from City c is returned. If the City cannot be found, an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        c - The City to lookup roads from.
        Returns:
        The Roads starting from City c, or empty list.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Calculates the hashCode of this country object using the name of the object.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The unique hashCode of this country object.

      • position

        public Position position(City city)
        Returns a new Position object of a specific city.
        Parameters:
        city - City to make a position of.
        Returns:
        Position object of city.

      • readyToTravel

        public Position readyToTravel(City from,
                              City to)
        Checks if the player is currently ready to travel between from and to. It does this through two if statements: Is the City in the country and is there a road between the two?
        Parameters:
        from - City to travel from.
        to - City to travel to.
        Returns:
        New Position object between from and to.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all cities' values in the Country to their initial values.

      • setGame

        public void setGame(Game game)
        Sets the current game object.
        Parameters:
        Game - object to set.
